text: Peggy McIntosh (born November 7, 1934) is an American feminist, anti-racism activist, scholar, speaker, and Senior Research Scientist of the Wellesley Centers for Women. She is the founder of the National SEED Project on Inclusive Curriculum (Seeking Educational Equity and Diversity).SEED Project website, at Wellesley Centers for Women. In 1988, she published the article "White Privilege and Male Privilege: A Personal Account of Coming to See Correspondences Through Work in Womenâ€™s Studies". This analysis, and its shorter version, "White Privilege: Unpacking the Invisible Knapsack" (1989) was later published and made her well known. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:American feminist writers Category:American political activists Category:Academics from Massachusetts Category:American essayists Category:Writers from New York City
title: Peggy McIntosh
